To the Editor: Of Bologna's many nicknames that Elisabetta Povoledo mentions ''In Bologna, a Grand Plaza Defines the City'' (Sept. 24), she omits what I consider the most engaging moniker: la citta delle belle donne -- the city of beautiful women.

A medical student in Bologna 50 years ago, I have wonderful memories of sipping my espresso at a sidewalk caffe on the Via Ugo Bassi near the Due Torri, and watching the parade of elegantly dressed women.

After I had completed my studies, my high school girlfriend sailed to Italy, and we were married in the Vatican. We toured Europe and although she was enthralled by all of Italy, it was in Bologna that she made the most memorable comment. Sitting with me at that same caffe, she said: ''How did you ever resist marrying one of these women?''
